reviews.review_text: The cutest to meet with anyone in Betalbatim. It's got a really nice vibe with live music sometimes. The food is mostly good. I would avoid the Apple Pie - as many times as I have had it, it's been uncooked unfortunately. Their in-house coconut ice cream is really good. Must try. Overall it's a great place with decent pricing. Alcohol is available. It's good to go with family friends or on a date. Service is great.
Food is good overall. Portion size is good for three people.  Service is decent and so is the ambience. Qual eggs wrapped in bacon is an interesting dish. Value for money

We stopped by on a weekday evening for dinner in mid December.
Good to see a lot of tourist crowds.
The exteriors decor & seating are very alluring, all Christmassy however the interiors are a bit dull & dimly lit. They played R&B and jazz music all the while. Staff had a proper uniform and were quick and courteous.
However the food was delicious.
The Menu is quiet extensive.
We ordered Barbeque chicken wings, which was yummy. The big crab Rechead Masala (600) was spicy & had tears rolling down my cheek, enjoyed it.
The chicken Steak sizzler was good as was the Fish & chips (500) , crispy & less oily.
However, we absolutely loved the Quail Soup (220). It was an absolute meal in itself & was very flavourful and well prepared. Highly recommended.
Our bill for four came upto around 3k including 3 mocktails.
